required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stage-Specific Recovery Changes in the International Classification of Functioning Components Following Conservative Rehabilitation of Trigger Finger
clinical_study.official_title: Stage-Specific Recovery Changes in the International Classification of Functioning Components Following Conservative Rehabilitation of Trigger Finger

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to determine the effectiveness of conservative rehabilitation on the multi-dimensional health components based on WHO ICF model in Stage 1, Stage 2 and Stage 3 trigger finger and to determine the functional recovery patterns of each dimension during a three-month rehabilitation period. Thirty-four patients were participated in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of triggering (ten active fist test / 30 second active fist test)

arm_group.description: Volunteer patients between 35-65 years old diagnosed with Stage 1, Stage 2 and Stage 3 trigger finger based on the Froimson Classification were included in the study. Exclusion criteria include paediatric trigger finger, trigger thumb, concomitant de'Quervain tenosynovitis, carpal tunnel syndrome, or Dupuytren's contracture, neurological or rheumatological diseases, chronic pain syndromes, pregnancy and patients with treatment history of related finger/fingers

intervention.description: All patients had rehabilitation for a total of three months, including activity modification, splinting and exercises.

study_pop.textblock: Diagnosed with Stage 1, Stage 2 and Stage 3 trigger finger based on the Froimson Classification

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with Stage 1, Stage 2 and Stage 3 trigger finger based on the Froimson Classification
Exclusion Criteria:
- Paediatric trigger finger, trigger thumb, concomitant de'Quervain tenosynovitis, carpal tunnel syndrome, or Dupuytren's contracture, neurological or rheumatological diseases, chronic pain syndromes, pregnancy and patients with treatment history of related finger/fingers.

overall_official.affiliation: Hacettepe University, Faculty of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation

facility.name: Hacettepe University Faculty of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation
